articles.description: The space agency said the pictures of the lunar surface were taken on August 23 by the Terrain Mapping Camera-2 of Chandrayaan-2 from an altitude of about 4,375 km.
articles.content: Chandrayaan-2, which is currently orbiting the Moon, has captured some more images of the lunar surface showing several craters, the Indian Space Research Organisation said on Monday Sharing the pict… [+1479 chars]

articles.author: ET EnergyWorld
articles.title: INNOVATION: Novel device creates electricity from snowfall - ETEnergyworld.com
articles.description: The device designed by researchers at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) is inexpensive, small, thin and flexible like a sheet of plastic.
articles.content: Los Angeles: Scientists have designed a first-of-its-kind 3D-printed device that can produce electricity from falling snow. The device designed by researchers at the University of California, Los Ang… [+2894 chars]
